args.natural_language_statement:
Translate the following and check correctness: For any $2\times 2$ improper orthogonal matrix $H$ (i.e., $H\in \mathrm{O}(2)$ and $\det H=-1$), the products $H_0H$ and $HH_0$ both belong to \mathrm{SO}(2), where $H_0=\begin{bmatrix}1&0\\0&-1\end{bmatrix}$ is reflection across the $x$-axis.
Save it to: srdoty_alg_linear-gps_577.lean

args.natural_language_statement: For any 2x2 improper orthogonal matrix H (i.e., H ∈ O(2) and det H = -1), the products H0 H and HH0 both belong to SO(2), where H0 = [[1,0],[0,-1]] is reflection across the x-axis. Save it to: srdoty_alg_linear-gps_577.lean

{"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open Matrix
open LinearMap
open Subgroup
open scoped Classical in

open Matrix MatrixGroups SpecialLinearGroup
open MatrixGroups
open Matrix Matrix.SpecialLinearGroup

/-- For any 2x2 improper orthogonal matrix H (i.e., H ∈ O(2) and det H = -1), the products H0 H and HH0 both belong to SO(2), where H0 = [[1,0],[0,-1]] is reflection across the x-axis. Save it to: srdoty_alg_linear-gps_577.lean -/

args.content:
import Mathlib

-- Reflection across the x-axis in 2x2 matrices.
 def H0 : Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ := ![![1, 0], ![0, -1]]

/-- For any 2x2 improper orthogonal matrix H (H ∈ O(2) and det H = -1),
    the products H0 * H and H * H0 belong to SO(2). -/
 theorem improper_orthogonal_products_in_SO
   (H : Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ)
   (hH : H ∈ OrthogonalGroup (Fin 2) ℝ)
   (hdet : H.det = -1) :
   H0 * H ∈ SpecialOrthogonalGroup (Fin 2) ℝ ∧ H * H0 ∈ SpecialOrthogonalGroup (Fin 2) ℝ := by
   sorry

args.natural_language_statement: For any 2x2 improper orthogonal matrix H (i.e., H ∈ O(2) and det H = -1), the products H0 H and H H0 both belong to SO(2), where H0 = [[1,0],[0,-1]] is reflection across the x-axis. Save it to: srdoty_alg_linear-gps_577.lean

import Mathlib

open Matrix

-- Reflection across the x-axis in 2x2 matrices.
 def H0 : Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ := ![![1, 0], ![0, -1]]

/-- For any 2x2 improper orthogonal matrix H (H ∈ OrthogonalGroup (Fin 2) ℝ, det H = -1),
    the products H0 * H and H * H0 belong to SO(2). -/

   (H : Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ)

   (hdet : H.det = -1) :
